Description: Fragment of flattened handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora to moderate turn. Clay near fine light orange-brown; cream slip. Circular stamp.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 136, 3 or 181, 31. Probably from same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, CEALEX TAL 128.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0402)
